recipes.name: Layered Grilled BBQ Chicken Quesadilla
ingredients: 1/2 lb boneless, skinless chicken breasts or tenders
1/4 cup Kraft's Spicy Honey BBQ Sauce, plus extra for serving
2 cups canned black beans, rinsed and drained
1/2 cup corn kernels (thawed if frozen, grilled if fresh)
3/4 cup (7 oz) Kraft's Shredded Mild Cheddar Cheese
1 cup (8 oz) Kraft's Shredded Mozzarella Cheese
directions: Step 1: Preheat grill to medium heat. In a bowl, combine chicken and 2-3 tablespoons of BBQ sauce. Set aside.
Step 2: Grill chicken for 4-5 minutes per side, or until fully cooked and grill marks appear. Optionally, grill tortillas for 30 seconds per side to warm them.
Step 3: Remove chicken from grill and slice into bite-sized pieces. Toss with remaining BBQ sauce (1-2 tablespoons or more, to taste).

Step 4: Assemble the quesadilla: Place one tortilla on a cutting board. Brush generously with BBQ sauce. Top with 1/4 cup black beans, one-fourth of the chicken, 1-2 tablespoons of corn, and a sprinkle of cheddar and mozzarella cheese.
Step 5: Repeat Step 4 with a second tortilla. Top with a third tortilla.

Step 6: Lightly spray the grill grates with cooking spray. Carefully slide the assembled quesadilla onto the grill. Cover and cook for 5 minutes, or until the cheese melts and the bottom tortilla is crispy.

Step 7: Using a wide spatula, carefully flip the quesadilla. Cook for another 5 minutes, or until the cheese is melted and the bottom tortilla is crispy. Sprinkle with additional cheddar and mozzarella cheese during the last few minutes of cooking.
Step 8: Remove the quesadilla from the grill and let rest for a few minutes. Top with pico de gallo, diced strawberries, extra corn, and additional BBQ sauce. Cut into wedges and serve.
recipes.image_prompt: Capture a layered grilled BBQ chicken quesadilla cut into wedges, revealing the melted cheese, chicken, beans, and corn.  Use a dark, rustic wooden backdrop and brightly colored Mexican-inspired textiles. Style with a small cast iron skillet, scattered pico de gallo, diced strawberries, and a drizzle of BBQ sauce.  Shoot from a slightly elevated angle with shallow depth of field, focusing on the cheesy interior.  Bright, natural lighting should highlight the textures and create a warm, inviting mood.  Include a small bowl of extra BBQ sauce for dipping.

recipes.name: Easy Grilled BBQ Chicken
ingredients: 2 lbs bone-in, skin-on chicken pieces (thighs, breasts, or drumsticks)
directions: Step 1: Preheat grill to medium-low heat.
Step 2: Lightly oil the grill grates with olive oil.
Step 3: Place chicken pieces on the preheated grill.
Step 4: Grill, covered, for 20 minutes.
Step 5: Turn chicken pieces over and grill for an additional 20 minutes.
Step 6: Baste chicken with BBQ sauce and grill for 5 minutes.
Step 7: Turn chicken pieces over, baste the other side with BBQ sauce, and grill for a final 5 minutes.
Step 8: Remove chicken from grill and let rest for a few minutes before serving.

scenes.text: Apple Bourbon BBQ Grilled Chicken Wings
scenes.voice_over: Get ready to fire up the grill for these incredible Apple Bourbon BBQ wings! Sweet, smoky, and sticky, they're the perfect game-day snack or party appetizer.

scenes.image_prompt: Ingredients arranged neatly on a wooden table: soy sauce, Dijon mustard, minced garlic, kosher salt, black pepper, BBQ rub, bourbon, apple juice, apple cider vinegar, and hot sauce.  Chicken wings are in a separate bowl.
scenes.voice_over: Here's what you'll need: soy sauce, Dijon mustard, minced garlic, kosher salt, black pepper, BBQ rub, bourbon, apple juice, apple cider vinegar, hot sauce, and of course, 3 pounds of chicken wings.

scenes.image_prompt: A large bowl with chicken wings being tossed in a marinade of soy sauce, Dijon, garlic, salt, and pepper.
scenes.voice_over: In a large bowl, whisk together the soy sauce, Dijon, garlic, salt, and pepper. Add the chicken wings and toss to coat. Cover and let them marinate in the fridge for at least 1-2 hours. This allows the wings to absorb all those delicious flavors.

scenes.image_prompt: Whisk together bourbon, apple juice, apple cider vinegar, hot sauce, and BBQ rub in a saucepan. Simmer the sauce and reduce heat.
scenes.voice_over: While the wings are marinating, let's make the star of the show: the apple bourbon BBQ sauce. Combine bourbon, apple juice, apple cider vinegar, hot sauce, and BBQ rub in a saucepan. Bring to a simmer over medium heat, then reduce heat and let it simmer for about 10-15 minutes, or until the sauce has thickened slightly.

scenes.image_prompt: Chicken wings arranged on a hot grill, flames visible in the background.
scenes.voice_over: Preheat your grill to medium heat. Lightly oil the grates to prevent sticking. Now, place the marinated wings on the grill, making sure not to overcrowd them. Grill for about 5-7 minutes per side, or until they're cooked through and nicely charred.

scenes.image_prompt: Grilling chicken wings being basted with apple bourbon BBQ sauce.
scenes.voice_over: During the last few minutes of grilling, generously baste the wings with the apple bourbon BBQ sauce. This will give them a gorgeous glaze and that signature sticky sweetness.

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up of finished apple bourbon BBQ grilled chicken wings, plated and ready to serve, garnished with chopped green onions and served with dipping sauce
scenes.voice_over: Once the wings are cooked through and beautifully glazed, remove them from the grill and let them rest for a few minutes. Garnish with some fresh green onions, and serve them up with your favorite dipping sauce like ranch or blue cheese.  These Apple Bourbon BBQ wings are finger-licking good!

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up of a platter of the finished wings, alongside suggested sides like coleslaw, potato salad, and corn on the cob.
scenes.voice_over: These wings are fantastic on their own, but they also pair perfectly with classic sides like coleslaw, potato salad, or corn on the cob.  Enjoy!

cooking_tips: For extra crispy wings, pat them dry with paper towels before grilling.
If you don't have apple juice, you can substitute with more apple cider vinegar and a touch of water.
Adjust the amount of hot sauce to your preferred level of spiciness.

recipes.name: Grilled Alabama BBQ Chicken with White Sauce
ingredients: 3 1/2-4 pounds chicken parts, patted dry, split
Vegetable oil, for greasing grill grate
directions: Step 1: Prepare the White BBQ Sauce: In a blender, combine mayonnaise, cider vinegar, sugar, horseradish, 1/2 teaspoon salt, 1/2 teaspoon black pepper, and 1/4 teaspoon cayenne pepper. Blend until smooth, about 1 minute.
Step 2: Chill the Sauce: Refrigerate the sauce in an airtight container for at least 1 hour, or up to 2 days.
Step 3: Prepare the Chicken: In a small bowl, combine 1 teaspoon salt, 1 teaspoon black pepper, and 1/2 teaspoon cayenne pepper.
Step 4: Season the Chicken: Rub the spice mixture all over the chicken pieces.
Step 5: Soak Wood Chips: Soak hickory chips in a bowl of water to cover for 15 minutes.
Step 6: Prepare the Grill: Open the bottom vents of the grill completely.
Step 7: Light Charcoal: Light a large chimney starter filled with charcoal briquettes (about 90 coals) and burn until the charcoal is covered with fine gray ash.
Step 8: Arrange Coals: Place a 13x9 inch disposable aluminum roasting pan in the center of the grill. Pour half of the lit coals in a pile on each side of the pan, leaving the pan in the center.
Step 9: Add Wood Chips: Scatter the soaked wood chips over the coals.
Step 10: Set Cooking Grate: Place the cooking grate in place.
Step 11: Preheat Grill: Cover the grill with the lid, positioning the vents over the center of the grill and opening them halfway. Let the grill heat for 5 minutes.
Step 12: Oil Grate: Dip a wad of paper towels in vegetable oil and, using long-handled tongs, oil the grill grate.
Step 13: Grill Chicken Skin-Side Down: Place the chicken pieces skin-side down on the center of the grill (not directly over the coals).
Step 14: Cover and Grill: Cover the grill, ensuring the vents are positioned over the chicken and opened halfway. Grill the chicken until the skin is well browned, 35 to 45 minutes.
Step 15: Flip and Grill: Flip the chicken pieces skin-side up and continue grilling, covered, until the breast meat registers 165°F on an instant-read thermometer, 15 to 20 minutes longer.
Step 16: Rest Chicken: Transfer the chicken to a cutting board, brush with 2 tablespoons of the white BBQ sauce, tent with foil, and let rest for 10 minutes.
Step 17: Serve: Remove the foil, brush the chicken with another tablespoon of sauce, carve, and serve, passing the remaining sauce at the table.

video_script.title: Grilled Alabama BBQ Chicken with White Sauce
video_script.description: Learn how to make authentic Alabama BBQ chicken with a creamy, tangy white sauce. This recipe is perfect for grilling season!

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up shot of finished grilled chicken, glistening with white sauce, garnished with chopped chives, and plated with coleslaw.
scenes.voice_over: Hey everyone, today we're making a classic: Grilled Alabama BBQ Chicken with White Sauce. This chicken is juicy, smoky, and slathered in a unique, tangy sauce. Get ready for a flavor explosion!

scenes.image_prompt: Ingredients laid out on a table: mayonnaise, cider vinegar, horseradish, sugar, salt, pepper, cayenne pepper.
scenes.voice_over: Let's start with the star of the show: the Alabama white sauce.  We'll need mayonnaise, cider vinegar, a touch of sugar, prepared horseradish, salt, black pepper, and a pinch of cayenne for a little kick.

scenes.image_prompt: Chicken parts on a plate seasoned with salt, pepper and cayenne. A bowl of water with soaking hickory chips.
scenes.voice_over: For the chicken, I recommend using a mix of parts like thighs, drumsticks, and breasts. Pat them dry and season generously with salt, pepper, and cayenne. Also, soak your hickory chips in water for at least 15 minutes. This helps create that delicious smoky flavor.

scenes.image_prompt: Charcoal chimney with lit coals.
scenes.voice_over: Get your grill going by lighting a chimney starter full of charcoal.  We want those coals nice and hot, covered in gray ash.  While that's heating up, blend all your white sauce ingredients until perfectly smooth.

scenes.image_prompt: Arrangement of charcoal on either side of a disposable aluminum pan with soaked hickory chips.
scenes.voice_over: Create a two-zone fire. Once the coals are ready, arrange them on either side of a disposable aluminum pan.  This indirect heat setup is key for perfectly grilled chicken. Scatter those soaked hickory chips over the coals now.

scenes.image_prompt: Chicken pieces arranged skin-side down on the center of the grill (not directly above coals)
scenes.voice_over: Place the chicken skin-side down over indirect heat, close the lid, and let it grill for 35-45 minutes, until the skin is golden brown and crispy.

scenes.image_prompt: Flipped chicken pieces skin-side up, grilling over indirect heat
scenes.voice_over: Time to flip! Continue grilling skin-side up for another 15-20 minutes, or until the internal temperature reaches 165°F. Use a meat thermometer for accuracy.

scenes.image_prompt: Chicken on a cutting board tented with foil.
scenes.voice_over: Once the chicken is cooked, transfer it to a cutting board, brush generously with that delicious white BBQ sauce, and tent it with foil. Let it rest for 10 minutes to seal in the juices.

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up shot of sliced, plated grilled chicken, generously coated in white sauce, with a small bowl of extra sauce on the side, garnished with chives and served with corn on the cob.
scenes.voice_over: Carve the chicken and serve it up. I like to brush on a little extra sauce before serving, and have some on the side for dipping.  Some classic Southern sides like coleslaw or corn on the cob go perfectly. Enjoy!

cooking_tips: For extra smoky flavor, use a smoker box or wrap additional wood chips in foil and poke holes in it.
Adjust the grilling time depending on the size and thickness of the chicken pieces.
Use a meat thermometer to ensure the chicken is cooked to a safe internal temperature of 165°F.

recipes.name: BBQ Chicken Drumsticks with Chipotle-Beer BBQ Sauce
ingredients: 3.5 oz chipotle peppers in adobo sauce (half of a 7 oz can)
1 1/2 cups amber lager beer (dark lager for a more pronounced flavor)
1-1 1/2 cups prepared chipotle-beer BBQ sauce (see recipe)
Salt and freshly ground black pepper, to taste
directions: Step 1: Make the Chipotle-Beer BBQ Sauce: In a deep, non-reactive pan, combine all BBQ sauce ingredients (chipotle peppers, beer, ketchup, garlic, Worcestershire sauce, vinegar, onion powder, brown sugar, granulated sugar, smoked paprika, salt, and pepper).
Step 2: Bring the sauce to a boil, then reduce heat to low-medium and simmer uncovered for 30 minutes.

Step 3: Using an immersion blender, puree the sauce until smooth. Return to heat and simmer for another 10 minutes, or until thickened and a deep dark color. Transfer to a container and set aside. (The recipe will need about 1 to 1 1/2 cups of sauce. Leftover sauce can be refrigerated for 1-2 months).
Step 4: Prepare the Chicken: Pat the chicken drumsticks dry with paper towels. Season generously with salt, pepper, and smoked paprika.
Step 5: Preheat Grill: Preheat your grill (gas, charcoal, or grill pan) to medium-high heat. Lightly coat the grill grates with cooking spray.
Step 6: Grill the Chicken: Place the chicken drumsticks on the hot grill, meaty side down. Sear for a few minutes, then reduce heat to medium and continue grilling for 15 minutes.
Step 7: Flip and Sauce: Turn the drumsticks and grill for another 15 minutes. During the last 5 minutes of grilling, brush generously with the chipotle-beer BBQ sauce.

Step 8: Finish Cooking: Continue grilling until the chicken is cooked through, reaching an internal temperature of 170°F (77°C) in the thickest part. If needed, transfer the chicken to a lower heat area of the grill or finish cooking in a 375°F (190°C) oven for a few minutes to ensure it's fully cooked.
Step 9: Serve: Transfer the BBQ chicken to a serving platter and slather with additional BBQ sauce, if desired.
recipes.image_prompt: Capture glistening BBQ chicken drumsticks, slathered in a deep, reddish-brown chipotle-beer BBQ sauce, against a rustic dark wood background. Focus on the crispy skin and sauce texture, using shallow depth of field to highlight the foreground drumstick.  Garnish with a sprinkle of chopped cilantro and a halved lime. Employ warm, directional lighting to accentuate the caramelization and create a rich, inviting mood. Compose the drumsticks slightly overlapping on a wooden serving board with a small bowl of extra sauce in the background, creating a dynamic and appetizing scene.

recipes.name: Grilled BBQ Chicken Pizza
ingredients: 1 cup shredded or thinly sliced grilled chicken
2 teaspoons minced garlic or 1/4 cup garlic cloves
Fresh cilantro, cracked sea salt, and black pepper, to taste
2 1/4 cups all-purpose flour, plus more as needed
directions: Step 1: Prepare the Dough: In a large bowl, combine warm water and sugar. Sprinkle yeast over the water and let stand for 5 minutes until foamy. Whisk in salt and 2 teaspoons of olive oil.

Step 2: Mix and Knead: Gradually add flour to the yeast mixture, stirring with a wooden spoon until a shaggy dough forms. Turn the dough out onto a lightly floured surface and knead for 2-3 minutes until smooth and elastic. Place the dough in a lightly oiled bowl, cover with plastic wrap, and let rise in a warm place for 45 minutes, or until doubled in size.
Step 3: Second Rise: Punch down the dough, cover, and let rise for another 30 minutes.

Step 4: Prepare the Grill and Crust: Preheat grill to medium heat. Roll out the dough into a 14-inch circle about 1/4 inch thick. Brush the dough with olive oil and sprinkle with Italian seasoning. Place the dough on a large piece of aluminum foil.

Step 5: Grill the Crust: Carefully transfer the foil with the dough to the preheated grill. Close the grill and cook for 5 minutes. Flip the crust and cook for another 5 minutes. If the crust browns too quickly, move it to a cooler part of the grill.

Step 6: Assemble and Grill the Pizza: Flip the crust back over so the oiled side is up. Spread half of the BBQ sauce over the crust. Top with mozzarella cheese, grilled chicken, garlic, red onion, and jalapeños. Close the grill and cook for 10 minutes, or until the cheese is melted and bubbly.

Step 7: Finish and Serve: Remove the pizza from the grill and top with the remaining BBQ sauce, cotija cheese, and cilantro. Season with cracked sea salt and black pepper to taste. Cut into slices and serve immediately.
recipes.image_prompt: Capture a grilled BBQ chicken pizza with studio lighting emphasizing texture and vibrant colors.  A slightly overhead, angled shot showcasing the charred crust and melted mozzarella, garnished with fresh cilantro. Use a dark, rustic wooden surface with a textured linen napkin.  Shallow depth of field focusing on the gooey cheese and a slice of jalapeño, blurring the background slightly.  Aim for a warm, inviting mood. Include scattered cotija crumbles and a hint of cracked sea salt for visual interest.

directions: Step 1: Preheat your grill to medium-high heat or oven to 400°F.

recipes.name: Honey-Chipotle BBQ Chicken Drumsticks with Corn-Jalapeno Succotash
ingredients: 1 (3.5 ounce) can chipotle peppers in adobo sauce
1 teaspoon coriander seeds (or 1/2 teaspoon coriander powder, optional)
Salt and black pepper to taste
directions: Step 1: Prepare the Honey-Chipotle BBQ Sauce: In a deep, heavy-bottomed saucepan, combine chipotle peppers in adobo sauce, honey, apple cider vinegar, ketchup, tomato paste, water, salt, coriander seeds (if using), crushed garlic, and black pepper. Mix well and bring to a boil.
Step 2: Simmer the Sauce: Reduce heat to medium-high and simmer for 25 minutes, stirring occasionally.

Step 3: Puree the Sauce: Let the sauce cool slightly, then puree using an immersion blender. Set aside if using immediately, or let it cool completely and store in a sealed container in the refrigerator until ready to use.
Step 4: Prepare the Chicken: Pat the chicken drumsticks dry with paper towels. Season generously with salt, black pepper, and smoked paprika.

Step 5: Grill the Chicken and Corn: Preheat your grill to medium-low heat. Coat the grill grates with oil spray. Place the chicken drumsticks on the grill, meaty side down. Grill for 12-15 minutes, then turn and cook the other side until fully cooked. Simultaneously, grill the corn on the cob, turning every 2-3 minutes, until nicely charred and cooked through.
Step 6: Apply BBQ Sauce: During the last 5 minutes of grilling, brush the chicken drumsticks generously with the honey-chipotle BBQ sauce and continue cooking.

Step 7: Make the Corn-Jalapeno Succotash: While the chicken and corn are grilling, prepare the succotash ingredients. Dice the red onion, bell pepper, jalapeno, and mince the garlic. Drain and rinse the chickpeas. Remove the kernels from the grilled corn cobs.

Step 8: Cook the Succotash: Heat canola oil in a wide saute pan over medium heat. Add the diced onion and bell pepper and cook for 2-3 minutes until softened. Add the minced garlic and cook for 30 seconds.

Step 9: Finish the Succotash: Add the diced jalapeno, chickpeas, sugar, vinegar, salt, and black pepper to the pan. Cook for another 3 minutes, or until the liquid has evaporated. Fold in the corn kernels and parsley. Remove from heat and set aside.
Step 10: Serve: Serve the BBQ chicken drumsticks with the corn-jalapeno succotash on the side.

recipes.name: BBQ Chicken Chopped Salad with Grilled Garlic Croutons
ingredients: 4 oz white cheddar cheese, chopped into small chunks
directions: Step 1: Marinate the Chicken: In a baking dish or ziplock bag, combine the chicken breasts, minced garlic, brown sugar, onion powder, salt, smoked paprika, and black pepper. Pour the barbecue sauce over the chicken, ensuring it's coated evenly. Marinate in the refrigerator for at least 30 minutes, or preferably overnight.

Step 2: Prepare the Grilled Garlic Croutons: Preheat your grill to high heat. Drizzle olive oil over both sides of the bread slices and sprinkle with garlic powder. Grill the bread for about 2 minutes per side, or until golden brown and toasted.

Step 3: Grill the Scallions and Corn: Place the whole scallions on the preheated grill and cook for 3-4 minutes per side, until charred. Simultaneously, grill the corn ears until toasted all around. Remove from grill and set aside to cool.
Step 4: Grill the Chicken: Grill the marinated chicken breasts for 6-8 minutes per side, or until the internal temperature reaches 165°F (74°C).

Step 5: Chop and Assemble the Salad: Once the grilled ingredients have cooled, chop the scallions (discarding the white ends), slice the corn kernels off the cob, and cut the chicken into bite-sized pieces. Cut the grilled bread into crouton-sized chunks.

Step 6: Combine Salad Ingredients: In a large bowl, combine the butter lettuce, arugula, and cilantro. Season with salt and pepper and toss gently. Add the grilled chicken, scallions, corn, tomatoes, bacon, avocado, and white cheddar cheese. Toss again to combine.

Step 7: Make the Honey Mustard Vinaigrette: In a separate bowl, whisk together the honey, Dijon mustard, minced garlic, salt, and pepper. Add the balsamic vinegar and whisk until smooth. Slowly drizzle in the olive oil while whisking constantly until emulsified.
Step 8: Serve the Salad: Add the croutons to the salad and toss gently. Serve immediately with the honey mustard vinaigrette on the side.

recipes.name: Honey BBQ Grilled Salmon
directions: Step 1: Preheat grill to medium-high heat.
Step 2: Pat salmon fillets dry with paper towels and rub with vegetable oil. Season with salt and pepper.
Step 3: In a small bowl, whisk together honey, ketchup, Worcestershire sauce, lemon juice, dill, ginger, and black pepper.
Step 4: Grill salmon for 5-8 minutes per side, basting frequently with the honey BBQ glaze, until the salmon is cooked through and flakes easily with a fork.
Step 5: Serve immediately, drizzled with any remaining glaze.

recipes.name: Spicy Grilled Tofu with Grilled Vegetables
ingredients: 1/2 pound extra-firm tofu (or 1 pound for larger servings)
1/2 pound mixed vegetables (such as bell peppers, carrots, and zucchini), sliced
1 tablespoon garlic paste or finely grated garlic
1 tablespoon grill seasoning (such as Montreal Chicken Seasoning)
directions: Step 1: Wrap the tofu block in paper towels and press gently to remove excess water. Pat dry.
Step 2: Prepare the vegetables: Trim and slice the bell peppers, carrots, and zucchini into desired sizes.
Step 3: In a large bowl, whisk together the rice vinegar, garlic, cayenne pepper, salt, black pepper, and olive oil to create a marinade.
Step 4: Add the tofu to the marinade and let it marinate for 5-10 minutes.
Step 5: Preheat the grill to medium-high heat. Lightly oil the grill grates.
Step 6: Place the marinated tofu on the hot grill. While the tofu cooks, add the prepared vegetables to the remaining marinade and toss to coat.

Step 7: Grill the tofu for about 5 minutes per side, or until grill marks appear and the tofu is lightly browned. Rotate the tofu 90 degrees halfway through cooking on each side to create diamond grill marks. Baste the tofu with the marinade while it cooks.
Step 8: Once the tofu is cooked, add the marinated vegetables to the grill. Cook the vegetables until tender-crisp and slightly charred, basting occasionally with the marinade.
Step 9: Remove the tofu and vegetables from the grill and serve immediately. Optionally, serve with grilled bread.
recipes.image_prompt: Capture grilled tofu and vibrant mixed vegetables, glistening with olive oil, on a rustic wooden board.  Use a slightly overhead angle with a shallow depth of field, focusing on the perfectly seared tofu. Soft, diffused natural light from the side should highlight the texture and char marks.  Garnish with a sprinkle of grill seasoning and chopped fresh herbs. The background should be dark and moody, creating a dramatic contrast with the colorful dish.  Include a small bowl of dipping sauce in the background, slightly out of focus.

scenes.image_prompt: Tofu block being wrapped in paper towels and pressed to remove excess water.
scenes.voice_over: First, press the tofu to remove excess water. Wrap it in paper towels and gently press. This helps the tofu absorb the marinade and crisp up nicely on the grill.

scenes.image_prompt: Vegetables being sliced on a cutting board.
scenes.voice_over: While the tofu is being pressed, slice your vegetables into even sizes so they cook uniformly.

scenes.voice_over: Now, combine the marinade ingredients in a large bowl and whisk well.

scenes.voice_over: Add the tofu to the marinade and let it soak for at least 5-10 minutes.  This allows the tofu to absorb all those delicious flavors.

scenes.voice_over: Preheat your grill to medium-high heat. Grill the tofu for about 5 minutes per side, rotating halfway through to get those beautiful diamond grill marks.

scenes.voice_over: Add the vegetables to the grill and cook until they're tender-crisp and slightly charred. Baste both the tofu and vegetables with the remaining marinade while they grill.

cooking_tips: For extra flavor, press the tofu for 30 minutes before marinating to remove more water and allow it to better absorb the marinade.

recipes.name: Grilled or Barbecued Lamb Chops
directions: Step 1: Trim excess fat from the lamb chops.
Step 2: In a bowl, combine the lamb chops, ketchup, lemon pepper, lemon juice, dried rosemary, olive oil, grated onion, and crushed garlic.
Step 3: Cover the bowl and refrigerate for at least 2 hours, or preferably overnight, to allow the lamb to marinate.
Step 4: Just before serving, remove the lamb chops from the marinade and discard the marinade.
Step 5: Preheat your grill or barbecue to medium-high heat.

Step 6: Grill or barbecue the lamb chops for 3-5 minutes per side, or until they reach your desired level of doneness.  Use a meat thermometer to check doneness - 130°F (54°C) for medium-rare, 140°F (60°C) for medium, 150°F (66°C) for medium-well.
Step 7: Remove the lamb chops from the grill and let them rest for a few minutes before serving.

recipes.name: Honey-Garlic Grilled Corn on the Cob
directions: Step 1: In a small bowl, combine the butter and honey. Microwave for approximately 30 seconds, or until melted. Stir in the crushed garlic and ground black pepper.
Step 2: Optionally, refrigerate the honey-garlic butter mixture for 15 minutes to allow the flavors to meld.
Step 3: Cut each ear of corn in half.
Step 4: Brush the honey-garlic butter mixture evenly over the corn halves. Wrap each corn half tightly in aluminum foil.
Step 5: Preheat a grill to medium-high heat. Place the foil-wrapped corn on the preheated grill and cook for 15-20 minutes, turning frequently to ensure even cooking.
Step 6: The corn is done when the foil starts to turn brown and the kernels are tender.

recipes.name: Grilled Citrus & Mustard BBQ Chicken
ingredients: ½ cup orange juice (no sugar added preferred)
¼ cup mustard BBQ sauce (such as Sweet Baby Ray's Sweet Golden Mustard)
directions: Step 1: Place the chicken breasts in a gallon-sized zippered bag.
Step 2: In a small bowl or measuring cup, whisk together the orange juice, olive oil, mustard BBQ sauce, lime juice, minced garlic, and dried cilantro.
Step 3: Pour the marinade over the chicken in the bag, seal tightly, and refrigerate for at least 2-3 hours, or preferably overnight.
Step 4: Preheat the grill to medium-high heat (375-400°F).
Step 5: Lightly spray the grill grates with non-stick cooking spray, if desired.
Step 6: Remove the chicken from the marinade and discard the leftover marinade.
Step 7: Grill the chicken for 7-9 minutes per side, or until cooked through and the internal temperature reaches 165°F.
Step 8: Serve immediately and enjoy!

recipes.name: Pulled Pork with Homemade BBQ Rub and Sauce
directions: Step 1: In a large zip-top bag, combine brown sugar, garlic salt, onion powder or onion salt, dry mustard, cayenne pepper, black pepper, and salt. Mix well.

Step 2: Rinse the pork butt and pat dry. Using a knife, poke small holes all over the surface of the pork. Place the pork in the bag with the dry rub, ensuring it's well coated. Seal the bag and refrigerate for at least 8 hours, or preferably overnight.

Step 3: In a saucepan, combine the remaining brown sugar, ketchup, tomato sauce, molasses, A-1 Steak Sauce, Worcestershire sauce, hot sauce, and lemon juice. Bring to a boil, stirring constantly to prevent sticking. Reduce heat and simmer for 15 minutes, or until slightly thickened. Let cool.
Step 4: Preheat oven to 300°F (150°C). Place the pork butt in a roasting pan and cook uncovered for 6 hours.
Step 5: Check the pork's tenderness. If it doesn't easily pull apart with a fork, continue cooking for another 30-60 minutes, or until it does.
Step 6: Once the pork is tender, remove it from the oven and let it rest for 15-20 minutes. Shred the pork using two forks.
Step 7: Pour the prepared BBQ sauce over the shredded pork and mix well.
Step 8: Serve the pulled pork on buns or enjoy it with a fork.

Focus on the tender, shredded texture of the pork, highlighting the rich mahogany color. Employ a shallow depth of field, focusing sharply on the foreground pork. Use natural, directional light to accentuate the smoky char and glossy sauce. Incorporate simple props like a vintage fork and a small cast iron skillet. Garnish with a sprinkle of fresh chopped cilantro for a pop of vibrant green.  Aim for a warm, inviting mood, evoking comfort and deliciousness.

scenes.voice_over: For our flavorful rub, we'll need brown sugar, garlic salt, onion powder, dry mustard, cayenne, black pepper, and salt.

scenes.image_prompt: A pork butt being rubbed with the dry rub mixture. Show the process of poking holes in the pork butt and ensuring it's evenly coated with the rub.
scenes.voice_over: Score the pork butt and rub it generously with our spice mix. Make sure to get into every nook and cranny.  We'll let this rest in the fridge for at least 8 hours, or even better, overnight.

scenes.image_prompt: Ingredients for the BBQ sauce neatly arranged on a table: brown sugar, ketchup, tomato sauce, molasses, A-1 Steak Sauce, Worcestershire sauce, hot sauce, and lemon juice.
scenes.voice_over: Now for the homemade BBQ sauce. We'll combine brown sugar, ketchup, tomato sauce, molasses, A-1 Steak Sauce, Worcestershire sauce, hot sauce, and lemon juice.

scenes.image_prompt: The BBQ sauce simmering in a saucepan on a stovetop. Show the sauce thickening as it simmers.
scenes.voice_over: Bring the sauce to a boil, then simmer for 15 minutes, stirring occasionally, until it thickens beautifully.

scenes.image_prompt: The pork butt in a roasting pan, placed in a preheated oven.
scenes.voice_over: Place the pork in a roasting pan and cook it uncovered at 300°F (150°C) for 6 hours.  Low and slow is key for that tender, fall-apart texture.

scenes.image_prompt: The cooked pork butt being pulled apart with two forks, showing how easily it shreds.
scenes.voice_over: After 6 hours, check the pork with a fork – it should shred easily. If not, give it another 30-60 minutes in the oven.  Let it rest before shredding.

scenes.image_prompt: The shredded pork being mixed with the prepared BBQ sauce in a large bowl.
scenes.voice_over: Now, drench the shredded pork in that delicious homemade BBQ sauce and mix it all up.

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up of a pulled pork sandwich being assembled, with the pulled pork piled high on a toasted bun.
scenes.voice_over: Serve this on your favorite buns, or enjoy it as is.  It's amazing with coleslaw and a side of potato salad or mac and cheese.

cooking_tips: For a smokier flavor, add a few drops of liquid smoke to the BBQ sauce.
If you prefer a sweeter BBQ sauce, increase the amount of brown sugar.
You can use a slow cooker instead of the oven. Cook on low for 8-10 hours.

recipes.name: Grilled Cilantro-Lime Pork Chops
directions: Step 1: Preheat grill to medium-high, direct heat.
Step 2: In a small bowl, combine olive oil, chopped cilantro, lime zest, and lime juice. Set aside.
Step 3: Sprinkle pork chops with garlic pepper seasoning and onion salt, rubbing into the meat.
Step 4: Grill pork chops for 3 minutes per side, covered.
Step 5: Brush pork chops with the cilantro-lime mixture, turn, and grill for another 3-5 minutes per side, or until the internal temperature reaches 160°F (71°C).
Step 6: Brush with remaining cilantro-lime mixture and turn once more before removing from the grill.
recipes.image_prompt: Capture four grilled cilantro-lime pork chops, 1-inch thick, with perfect grill marks, on a rustic wooden board.  Garnish with fresh cilantro sprigs and lime wedges. Utilize soft, directional natural light from the side to highlight the juicy texture and golden-brown color.  Shallow depth of field, focusing on the front chop, blurring the background. Aim for a bright, inviting mood with vibrant greens and warm browns. Incorporate a textured linen napkin and a scattering of lime zest for added visual interest.  Shoot from a slightly elevated angle, showcasing the chop's thickness.

video_script.title: Grilled Cilantro-Lime Pork Chops
video_script.description: Juicy and flavorful pork chops grilled to perfection with a vibrant cilantro-lime marinade.

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up shot of two perfectly grilled cilantro-lime pork chops on a plate, garnished with fresh cilantro and lime wedges. The pork chops are slightly charred on the outside, juicy on the inside, and coated in a vibrant green cilantro-lime mixture. Focus on the texture and color of the dish.
scenes.voice_over: Get ready for a flavor explosion with these grilled cilantro-lime pork chops! Tender, juicy, and bursting with zesty freshness, they're the perfect weeknight meal.

scenes.image_prompt: Overhead shot of all ingredients neatly arranged on a wooden cutting board. Include pork chops, garlic pepper seasoning, onion salt, olive oil, fresh cilantro, lime zest, and lime juice.
scenes.voice_over: Here's what you'll need: four boneless pork loin chops, garlic pepper seasoning, onion salt, olive oil, fresh cilantro, lime zest, and lime juice.

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up shot of hands combining olive oil, chopped cilantro, lime zest, and lime juice in a small bowl. The mixture should appear vibrant and well combined.
scenes.voice_over: First, let's make the cilantro-lime marinade. In a small bowl, combine olive oil, chopped cilantro, lime zest, and fresh lime juice. Mix well and set aside.

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up of hands sprinkling garlic pepper seasoning and onion salt onto both sides of the pork chops, then rubbing it into the meat.
scenes.voice_over: Next, season both sides of your pork chops generously with garlic pepper seasoning and onion salt. Rub the seasoning into the meat to ensure maximum flavor.

scenes.image_prompt: Medium shot of pork chops grilling on a preheated grill over medium-high, direct heat. The grill grates should be visible, with flames flickering beneath.
scenes.voice_over: Preheat your grill to medium-high, direct heat. Place the seasoned pork chops on the grill, cover, and cook for 3 minutes per side.

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up shot of basting the grilled pork chops with the cilantro-lime mixture. The pork chops should be slightly charred and glistening with the marinade.
scenes.voice_over: Now, brush the pork chops with the cilantro-lime mixture, turn them over, and continue grilling for another 3-5 minutes per side.

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up shot of a meat thermometer inserted into the thickest part of a pork chop, reading 160°F (71°C).
scenes.voice_over: Use a meat thermometer to ensure the pork chops are cooked through. The internal temperature should reach 160°F (71°C).

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up shot of brushing the pork chops with the remaining cilantro-lime mixture one last time before removing them from the grill.
scenes.voice_over: For that extra burst of flavor, brush the chops with the remaining cilantro-lime mixture and turn them once more before taking them off the grill.

scenes.image_prompt: Overhead shot of the finished grilled cilantro-lime pork chops plated on a serving platter, garnished with fresh cilantro sprigs and lime wedges. A side of rice and grilled vegetables can also be included in the shot.
scenes.voice_over: Serve these delicious pork chops with your favorite sides, such as rice and grilled vegetables. Enjoy!

cooking_tips: Use a meat thermometer to ensure the pork chops are cooked to a safe internal temperature.
If you don't have fresh cilantro, you can substitute with 1 tablespoon of dried cilantro.
For extra flavor, marinate the pork chops in the cilantro-lime mixture for at least 30 minutes before grilling.

recipes.name: Grilled Orange-Maple Mustard Glazed Pork Chops
ingredients: Freshly ground black pepper, to taste
directions: Step 1: Preheat grill to medium heat.
recipes.image_prompt: Capture four grilled orange-maple mustard glazed pork chops on a dark slate board, garnished with fresh orange slices and sprigs of thyme.  Use a slightly overhead, angled shot to showcase the grill marks and glaze.  Focus on the front chop, with a shallow depth of field blurring the background. Employ soft, directional lighting highlighting the chop's texture and the glaze's sheen. Create a rustic, inviting mood with warm tones and subtle highlights. Incorporate a linen napkin casually draped beside the board for added texture and visual interest.

video_script.title: Grilled Orange-Maple Mustard Glazed Pork Chops
video_script.description: Juicy and flavorful pork chops grilled to perfection with a sweet and savory orange-maple mustard glaze.

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up shot of two perfectly grilled pork chops drizzled with orange-maple mustard glaze, garnished with fresh green onions. The pork chops are slightly charred on the outside and juicy on the inside.  A serving suggestion of a side salad is included.
scenes.text: Grilled Orange-Maple Mustard Glazed Pork Chops
scenes.voice_over: Get ready for a flavor explosion with these grilled pork chops! The orange-maple glaze adds a touch of sweetness and tang, making them irresistible.

scenes.image_prompt: 4 thick-cut, boneless pork chops arranged neatly on a wooden cutting board.
scenes.voice_over: Here's what you'll need:  Four one-inch thick boneless pork chops – the star of our show.

scenes.image_prompt: Small bowls containing Dijon mustard, maple syrup, sliced green onions, orange zest, salt, and pepper arranged on a table.
scenes.voice_over: For the glaze, you'll need Dijon mustard, maple syrup, fresh green onions, orange zest, salt, and pepper.

scenes.image_prompt: A bowl with the glaze ingredients being whisked together until well combined.
scenes.voice_over: In a bowl, whisk together the Dijon mustard, maple syrup, green onions, and orange zest. Season with salt and pepper to taste.

scenes.image_prompt: Pork chops being brushed with the orange-maple mustard glaze on both sides.
scenes.voice_over: Generously brush the pork chops on both sides with the glaze. Allow the chops to marinate for at least 15 minutes at room temperature or longer in the refrigerator for deeper flavor.

scenes.image_prompt: A preheated grill with flames.
scenes.voice_over: Preheat your grill to medium heat. Make sure your grill grates are clean and oiled to prevent sticking.

scenes.image_prompt: Pork chops cooking on a grill, with grill marks forming.
scenes.voice_over: Place the marinated pork chops on the preheated grill. Grill for about 4-5 minutes per side, or until the internal temperature reaches 145°F. Adjust grilling time depending on the thickness of your pork chops and grill heat.

scenes.image_prompt: Glazed pork chops resting on a cutting board, tented with foil.
scenes.voice_over: Once cooked, remove the pork chops from the grill and let them rest for about 5-10 minutes, loosely tented with foil, before slicing and serving. This helps retain the juices and makes them even more tender.

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up shot of two sliced grilled pork chops drizzled with extra glaze and garnished with fresh green onions on a plate.
scenes.voice_over: Slice and serve the grilled pork chops with your favorite sides. These chops are delicious with a simple side salad, roasted vegetables, or mashed potatoes.  Each serving packs approximately 350 calories, 30 grams of protein, 15 grams of carbs, and 15 grams of fat. Enjoy!

cooking_tips: Trim excess fat from the pork chops for a healthier meal and to prevent flare-ups on the grill.
Soak wooden skewers in water for at least 30 minutes before grilling to prevent them from burning.
For a smoky flavor, add wood chips to your grill.
Use a meat thermometer to ensure the pork chops reach an internal temperature of 145°F (63°C) for safe consumption.
Let the pork chops rest for a few minutes after grilling before slicing and serving to allow the juices to redistribute.

recipes.name: Grilled Tri-Tip Roast
directions: 1. Prepare the Marinade: In a small bowl or mortar and pestle, combine the minced garlic, lime juice, liquid smoke, onion powder, sea salt, smoked paprika, and black pepper. Mix until a paste forms.
2. Adjust Marinade Consistency: Add a splash of apple juice to the paste until it reaches a spreadable consistency.
3. Marinate the Tri-Tip: Spread the paste evenly over the tri-tip roast. Allow it to marinate for at least 1 hour, or longer for enhanced flavor.
4. Alternative Dry Rub: If using a dry rub, apply 1 tablespoon per pound of meat, rubbing it in thoroughly. Let the roast sit for at least 40 minutes before grilling.

5. Preheat the Grill (Gas): Preheat a gas grill on high until the temperature reaches over 400°F (approximately 10-15 minutes). Once hot (425°F or higher), clean the grates with a wire brush. Create two zones of heat by turning off one burner while keeping the others on medium-high.

6. Preheat the Grill (Charcoal): Light wood briquettes in a chimney starter. Allow them to burn until 90% of the coals are glowing hot (about 15 minutes). Dump the hot coals onto one side of the grill, leaving the other side open. Place the grill grate and clean it with a wire brush.
7. Sear the Tri-Tip: Place the tri-tip roast fat-side up directly over the hot side of the grill. Sear for 5-7 minutes. Turn the roast and sear the other side for another 5-7 minutes.

8. Cook over Indirect Heat: Move the tri-tip to the cooler side of the grill (indirect heat). Continue cooking for approximately 15 minutes, turning as needed, until the thickest part reaches medium-rare (130-135°F).
9. Even Cooking Tip: For more even cooking, position the thicker part of the roast toward the coals and the thinner ends pointing away once it's moved to the indirect heat side.

10. Rest and Carve: Remove the tri-tip from the grill once it reaches the desired internal temperature. Transfer it to a cutting board, tent loosely with aluminum foil, and let it rest for 10 minutes before carving.
11. Carving: Slice the tri-tip against or across the grain for optimal tenderness.
recipes.image_prompt: Capture a grilled tri-tip roast, sliced to reveal its juicy pink center, resting on a dark wooden cutting board.  Scattered around are charred lime wedges and sprigs of rosemary.  Use a shallow depth of field, focusing on the glistening meat.  Soft, directional light from the side should highlight the texture and deep brown crust.  The background should be dark and moody, with a subtle bokeh effect.  Include a small cast iron skillet in the background, slightly out of focus.  Garnish with flaky sea salt and cracked black pepper.  Aim for a rustic yet refined aesthetic.

video_script.title: Grilled Tri-Tip Roast: Flavor Explosion
video_script.description: Learn how to grill a juicy and flavorful tri-tip roast with a simple marinade or dry rub. Perfect for any occasion!

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up shot of a perfectly grilled tri-tip roast, sliced to reveal its juicy pink interior.  Garnish with fresh herbs and serve on a wooden cutting board.
scenes.voice_over: Hey everyone, and welcome! Today we're firing up the grill for a mouthwatering tri-tip roast. It's incredibly easy to make, and the flavor is out of this world.

scenes.image_prompt: Display all ingredients neatly arranged on a table.  Focus on the tri-tip roast, garlic, lime, spices, and apple juice.
scenes.voice_over: For this recipe, you'll need a 2-pound tri-tip roast, garlic, lime juice, liquid smoke, onion powder, sea salt, smoked paprika, black pepper, and a touch of apple juice for the marinade.

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up of hands combining minced garlic, lime juice, liquid smoke, and spices in a bowl, mixing into a paste.
scenes.voice_over: Let's start with the marinade. In a bowl, combine minced garlic, lime juice, liquid smoke, onion powder, salt, paprika, and pepper. Mix it into a paste, then thin it out with a splash of apple juice.

scenes.image_prompt: Hands spreading the marinade evenly over the tri-tip roast. Show the roast being placed in a container and covered.
scenes.voice_over: Spread the marinade all over your tri-tip and let it soak up all that flavor for at least an hour, or even longer for best results.

scenes.image_prompt: Show a gas grill preheating with flames visible. Then, show a hand using a wire brush to clean the grill grates.
scenes.voice_over: Preheat your gas grill to high, over 400°F.  Clean those grates once it's hot.

scenes.image_prompt: Show a charcoal chimney starter with glowing briquettes being poured onto one side of a grill. Then, a hand cleans the grill grate with a wire brush.
scenes.voice_over: If using charcoal, let the briquettes burn until they're mostly ashed over. Dump them on one side for two-zone cooking, then clean the grate.

scenes.image_prompt: Tri-tip roast searing on the hot side of the grill, flames licking around it. Show the roast being flipped after searing one side.
scenes.voice_over: Now, sear the tri-tip over high heat for 5-7 minutes per side.  Get that beautiful crust!

scenes.image_prompt: Tri-tip roast cooking over indirect heat on the cooler side of the grill. Show the thicker part of the roast positioned closer to the coals.
scenes.voice_over: Move the tri-tip to the cooler side and cook for about 15 minutes, turning occasionally, until it reaches 130-135°F for medium-rare.

scenes.image_prompt: Tri-tip roast resting on a cutting board, tented with foil.  A meat thermometer inserted shows the internal temperature.
scenes.voice_over: Once it's cooked, let it rest for 10 minutes under foil before carving.

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up shot of slicing the rested tri-tip roast against the grain on a wooden cutting board.
scenes.voice_over: Slice against the grain for maximum tenderness, and get ready to enjoy!

scenes.image_prompt: Show the sliced tri-tip roast served on a platter, garnished with fresh herbs. Include serving suggestions like grilled vegetables or a salad.
scenes.voice_over: This grilled tri-tip is perfect as is, or serve it with your favorite sides.  Thanks for watching!

cooking_tips: Trim excess fat from the tri-tip to about 1/4 inch thick if needed.
If the roast is lean, drizzle it with olive oil during grilling to prevent drying.
For extra flavor, top the grilled tri-tip with herbed compound butter.

recipes.name: Easy Italian Grilled Burgers
directions: 1. Preheat grill to medium-high heat.
2. In a large bowl, combine ground beef, Parmesan cheese, basil, Italian seasoning, salt, and pepper. Gently mix until just combined. Do not overmix.
3. Shape the beef mixture into 6 equal-sized patties.
4. Grill the patties for 5-7 minutes per side, or until the internal temperature reaches 160°F (71°C) using an instant-read thermometer.
5. Place the grilled patties on the bottom halves of the Kaiser rolls and garnish as desired.
recipes.image_prompt: Capture two juicy Italian grilled burgers on toasted Kaiser rolls, overflowing with melted mozzarella and garnished with fresh basil. Focus on the textures of the charred patty, melted cheese, and crisp roll. Use a shallow depth of field to highlight the burger in the foreground, with a softly blurred background of rustic wooden boards and a checkered napkin. Employ warm, natural lighting to enhance the golden hues of the burger and rolls, creating a comforting and inviting mood. Shoot from a slightly elevated, three-quarter angle to showcase the burger's height and layers.

video_script.title: Easy Italian Grilled Burgers
video_script.description: Learn how to make juicy and flavorful Italian grilled burgers with simple ingredients. This recipe is perfect for a quick weeknight dinner or a weekend barbecue.

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up shot of a perfectly grilled Italian burger on a toasted Kaiser roll, garnished with fresh basil and a side of crispy potato wedges.
scenes.voice_over: Welcome to my kitchen! Today, we're making delicious Italian grilled burgers that are bursting with flavor. These juicy burgers are perfect for any occasion.

scenes.image_prompt: Overhead shot of all ingredients neatly arranged on a wooden table: ground beef, Parmesan cheese, fresh basil, Italian seasoning, salt, pepper, and Kaiser rolls.
scenes.voice_over: Here's what you'll need: Ground beef, Parmesan cheese, fresh basil, Italian seasoning, salt, pepper, and Kaiser rolls for serving.

scenes.image_prompt: Large bowl with ground beef, Parmesan cheese, basil, Italian seasoning, salt, and pepper being gently mixed together.
scenes.voice_over: In a large bowl, combine the ground beef, Parmesan cheese, chopped basil, Italian seasoning, salt, and pepper. Gently mix until just combined, being careful not to overmix. Overmixing can result in tough burgers.

scenes.image_prompt: Beef mixture being shaped into 6 equal-sized patties.
scenes.voice_over: Divide the mixture into six equal portions and shape them into patties about 3/4-inch thick.

scenes.image_prompt: Patties grilling on a preheated grill with flames visible in the background.
scenes.voice_over: Preheat your grill to medium-high heat. Grill the patties for 5-7 minutes per side, or until the internal temperature reaches 160°F (71°C).

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up shot of a cooked burger patty being checked with an instant-read thermometer.
scenes.voice_over: Use an instant-read thermometer to ensure the burgers are cooked through. We are aiming for safe internal temperature.

scenes.image_prompt: Grilled patties placed on the bottom halves of toasted Kaiser rolls.
scenes.voice_over: Place the grilled patties on the bottom halves of the Kaiser rolls.

scenes.image_prompt: Overhead shot of two fully assembled Italian grilled burgers, garnished with fresh basil and served with a side of potato wedges.
scenes.voice_over: Garnish your burgers as desired. I like to add some fresh basil leaves. Serve with your favorite sides like potato wedges, a fresh salad, or some grilled vegetables. Enjoy!

cooking_tips: For juicier burgers, avoid overmixing the ground beef.
Make a small indentation in the center of each patty before grilling to prevent them from bulging.
Toast the buns on the grill for a few seconds for added flavor and texture.
Let the burgers rest for a few minutes after grilling before serving to allow the juices to redistribute.

recipes.name: Sweet & Savory Grilled Chicken Thighs
directions: Step 1: In a bowl, combine the teriyaki sauce, soy sauce, ketchup, ground ginger, and caster sugar.
Step 2: Add the chicken thighs to the marinade, ensuring they are fully coated. Marinate for at least 20 minutes, or up to 2 hours in the refrigerator.
Step 3: Preheat the grill to medium-high heat.
Step 4: Grill the chicken thighs for 5-7 minutes per side, or until cooked through and the internal temperature reaches 165°F (74°C). Rotate the chicken halfway through each side for even browning.
Step 5:  Do not turn the chicken more than once per side.  Once cooked, remove the chicken from the grill and let it rest for a few minutes before serving.
recipes.image_prompt: Capture two glistening, grilled chicken thighs, glazed with a rich teriyaki, soy, and ketchup sauce, against a dark, rustic wooden backdrop.  Garnish with finely chopped ginger and a sprinkle of sesame seeds. Use a slightly overhead, angled shot to showcase the texture and char marks.  Shallow depth of field, focusing sharply on the closest thigh, with a soft, warm, inviting mood. Employ chiaroscuro lighting to highlight the glossy glaze and create deep shadows, emphasizing the succulent texture.

video_script.title: Sweet & Savory Grilled Chicken Thighs
video_script.description: Learn how to make delicious and easy sweet & savory grilled chicken thighs with a simple marinade. Perfect for a quick weeknight dinner or a weekend barbecue!

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up shot of two perfectly grilled chicken thighs, glistening with the sweet and savory glaze.  They are plated on a bed of fluffy white rice, garnished with chopped green onions.  The background is slightly blurred, emphasizing the chicken.
scenes.voice_over: Hey everyone, and welcome! Today, we're making incredibly flavorful and juicy sweet and savory grilled chicken thighs.  This recipe is quick, easy, and guaranteed to be a family favorite.

scenes.image_prompt: Ingredients are arranged neatly on a wooden cutting board.  Two boneless, skinless chicken thighs are in the foreground. Behind them are small bowls containing: teriyaki sauce, soy sauce, ketchup, ground ginger, and caster sugar.  A measuring spoon rests beside the sugar.
scenes.voice_over: Here's what you'll need: two boneless, skinless chicken thighs, teriyaki sauce, soy sauce, ketchup, ground ginger, and some caster sugar. Feel free to use a sugar substitute if you prefer.

scenes.image_prompt: A glass bowl containing the marinade ingredients: teriyaki sauce, soy sauce, ketchup, ground ginger, and caster sugar being whisked together.
scenes.voice_over: In a bowl, combine the teriyaki sauce, soy sauce, ketchup, ground ginger, and caster sugar. Whisk everything together until the sugar dissolves and the marinade is well combined.

scenes.image_prompt: The chicken thighs are placed in the marinade within a zip-top bag, ensuring they are fully coated. The bag is sealed and being placed into a refrigerator.
scenes.voice_over: Add the chicken thighs to the marinade, making sure they're fully coated.  For the best flavor, let them marinate for at least 20 minutes, or up to 2 hours in the refrigerator.

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up shot of grill grates with flames visible underneath.  The grill is preheating to medium-high heat.  Smoke is slightly visible.
scenes.voice_over: While the chicken marinates, preheat your grill to medium-high heat.

scenes.image_prompt: The marinated chicken thighs are carefully placed onto the hot grill grates.
scenes.voice_over: Now, carefully place the chicken thighs on the preheated grill.  We'll grill them for about 5-7 minutes per side, until they are cooked through and reach an internal temperature of 165°F or 74°C.

scenes.image_prompt: The chicken thighs are being rotated 90 degrees on the grill using tongs after grilling for half their designated time.
scenes.voice_over: Make sure to rotate the chicken about halfway through each side to ensure even browning. Only flip the chicken once per side for optimal results. Avoid turning too frequently to prevent sticking.

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up on a meat thermometer being inserted into the thickest part of a grilled chicken thigh, registering 165°F.
scenes.voice_over: Use a meat thermometer to verify the chicken is cooked to perfection.  Insert it into the thickest part of the thigh. It should read 165°F or 74°C.

scenes.image_prompt: The cooked chicken thighs are resting on a cutting board, lightly tented with foil.
scenes.voice_over: Once cooked, remove the chicken from the grill and let it rest for a few minutes before serving.  This allows the juices to redistribute, resulting in a more tender and flavorful chicken thigh.

scenes.image_prompt: Two grilled chicken thighs, beautifully glazed, are plated with a side of steamed rice and a fresh green salad.  A sprinkle of sesame seeds garnishes the chicken.
scenes.voice_over: These sweet and savory grilled chicken thighs are delicious served with rice and a fresh salad. You can also enjoy them with roasted vegetables or your favorite sides. Enjoy!

cooking_tips: For a smokier flavor, add a pinch of smoked paprika to the marinade.
If using bone-in chicken thighs, increase the cooking time as needed.
Serve with rice and your favorite grilled vegetables.
